verses: Unto the end, for Idithun, a psalm of David.

Shall not my soul be subject to God?  for from him is my
salvation.

For he is my God and my saviour:  he is my protector, I shall be
moved no more.

How long do you rush in upon a man?  you all kill, as if you were
thrusting down a leaning wall, and a tottering fence.

But they have thought to cast away my price; I ran in thirst:
they blessed with their mouth, but cursed with their heart.

But be thou, O my soul, subject to God:  for from him is my
patience.

For he is my God and my saviour:  he is my helper, I shall not be
moved.

In God is my salvation and my glory:  he is the God of my help,
and my hope is in God.

Trust in him, all ye congregation of people:  pour out your hearts
before him.  God is our helper for ever.

But vain are the sons of men, the sons of men are liars in the
balances:  that by vanity they may together deceive.

Trust not in iniquity, and cover not robberies:  if riches
abound, set not your heart upon them.

God hath spoken once, these two things have I heard, that power
belongeth to God,

And mercy to thee, O Lord; for thou wilt render to every man
according to his works.
